text:
Hi everyone, my buddy Peep is hiring a Demand Gen Manager for his startup <http://wynter.com|wynter.com> (you might have heard about it). If you know anyone in your circle who might be interested, please DM me so I can pass on the reference! Thank you :heart:

Here are the requirements, pay is $70k – $90k, position remote.

text:
Anyone looking for pro bono content strategy/SEO work? I've got 3+ years of experience (stemming from 5+ years in the field as a content writer) and have generated these results for my current employer (screenshots attached):


• :ballot_box_with_check: 190% increase organic MQLs (MQL = lead that requested a demo) 
• :ballot_box_with_check: Strongest year for organic leads 
• :ballot_box_with_check:149% increase in Avg. session duration 
• :ballot_box_with_check:15.23% bounce rate reduction
• :ballot_box_with_check: 24% increase in pageviews
Catch is I'd like to to use our project together as a case study and talk about it in my own content. If you're interested, get in touch or reach me on @<mailto:hassancopywrite@gmail.com|hassancopywrite@gmail.com>

text: I use wave, and just tried out a free version of Honeybooks...and HB was just wayyyy more than I needed, and I didn't want to pay for what I didn't need. However, I think that maybe it would work if I needed additional services to track like proposals/contracts. Since I'm a one person band, it's easy with Wave, but if I had freelancers working with me or if I had to track a pipeline I would consider adding it.

text:
Since I've heard this topic come up a few times in different freelance communities, wanted to share a free <https://my.demio.com/ref/IzdMrLuHJdKSPokk|workshop on value-based pricing> that I found useful. A few notes for the sake of transparency:

1. Yes, it's gated. But worth it IMO.
2. The company behind it, IndeCollective, is recruiting for their next 10-week, cohort-based program for freelancers right now (starts end of March). You may hear from their founder, Sam, if you sign up for this. I can confirm that Sam is a wonderful human and entrepreneur and really just wants to build a strong community of independents
3. I was part of IndeCollective's Fall cohort. I learned so much about building and growing my business during those 10 weeks, made so many new friends, and even ended up with some really fun client work from other members

attachments.fallback: Value-Based Pricing: Know Your Worth, So You Can Confidently Raise Your Rates
attachments.text: Know Your Worth, So You Can Confidently Raise Your Rates!
attachments.title: Value-Based Pricing: Know Your Worth, So You Can Confidently Raise Your Rates

text: I use FreshBooks and highly recommend it (:wave: <@UUJBM2PJ7>!) Honestly, the best bank that I've found for business use is the same as I use for personal use because of the ease of transferring money back and forth. However, if you think you might be dealing with international customers, I recommend Wise.

elements.text: I use FreshBooks and highly recommend it (

!) Honestly, the best bank that I've found for business use is the same as I use for personal use because of the ease of transferring money back and forth. However, if you think you might be dealing with international customers, I recommend Wise.

text:
Thanks! <@U01P833NGUT> <@UUJBM2PJ7> - I'd always been under the impression that Freshbooks was primarily meant for accounting. I don't know why I've thought that, but I do :shrug::skin-tone-2:

Can Freshbooks also do proposals/contracts/projects and so on?

elements.text: Thanks!
- I'd always been under the impression that Freshbooks was primarily meant for accounting. I don't know why I've thought that, but I do
Can Freshbooks also do proposals/contracts/projects and so on?

text: <@U02SU2BECCA> Yes! Not a true replacement for full-on project management software, but you can definitely use it to generate <https://www.freshbooks.com/proposal-software|estimates & proposals> (and flip them into invoices once accepted) and it's great for <https://www.freshbooks.com/projects-and-collaboration|collaborating with clients / teammates>. As well as working there, I run all my side hustle on it. (Don't want to get hardcore salesy here, but definitely reco a trial if you want to kick tires).

attachments.fallback: FreshBooks: The Best Proposal Software To Win Clients - FreshBooks
attachments.text: Win your clients with custom proposals by sending them all the details and supported attachments with FreshBooks online proposal software!
attachments.title: The Best Proposal Software To Win Clients - FreshBooks

attachments.fallback: FreshBooks: Best Project Management & Collaboration Software - FreshBooks
attachments.text: FreshBooks is the best project management & collaboration software designed to power your business with intuitive task management & file storage. Free 30-day trial!
attachments.title: Best Project Management & Collaboration Software - FreshBooks

text: <@UUJBM2PJ7> why do you prefer Freshbooks instead of Quickbooks (besides that you work there?) - for someone who is a one-woman freelancer band, let's say :wink:

text: <@U023G1P70KE> obviously working there is a HUGE driver, so I'm not going to lie about that. But I'm most definitely a non-accountant and want to get in-and-out of all the money stuff as quickly as possible. QB is really built for accountants, not for people like me. FB just honestly feels like "just enough accounting" for somebody like me... If I quit tomorrow, I would keep using it tbh.

text:
Hello everyone. If you're looking for a conversion copywriter, I can help you:

• Create new sales email sequences/onboarding email sequences for your upcoming launches
• Write new landing pages for your products or funnels, or FB ad campaigns
• Edit your website copy or write new web pages
• Get input on your funnel strategy or existing copy assets

Shoot me a DM and lemme see how I can help ya out.

Write new landing pages for your products or funnels, or FB ad campaigns
Edit your website copy or write new web pages

Shoot me a DM and lemme see how I can help ya out.

text:
Hi all! I'm a content writer and I'm trying to improve my business systems.

I just signed up for a Freshbooks trial and I'm building out my proposal template Would anyone be willing to share an example of what their proposal/contract looks like? If you have any favorite resources on the topic, that would also be awesome.

Cheers!

text:
Congrats on working on improving your business systems, Lawrence! Good journey to make :muscle:

Here’s the consulting proposal template I use: <http://consultingproposaltemplate.com|consultingproposaltemplate.com> (feel free to make a copy.)

For contracts I use the <http://MSABundle.com|MSABundle.com>. I bought it ~8 years ago (~$125?) and use the heck out of it. _(I did have my attorney review and modify it, but it’s still pretty close to stock.)_

text:
Hey all, just wondering if any freelancers in here have a VA?
I'm a content writer and strategist and am working consistent 40hr weeks for retainer clients. I'm at a point where I want to offload some of the tasks I don't enjoy as much, but I'm not sure how to go about finding someone that is the right fit.
Have you gone from solo freelancer > freelancer with contractors to help out > small agency? How did that progression go and is there any advice you can give ? Thanks fam :v:

elements.text:
